Kane Tanaka, believed to be the world's oldest person, has passed away.
Tanaka was born on January 2, 1903, and she died on April 19.
Her cause of death was not revealed.
Tanaka survived cancer twice, survived two World Wars...
...and survived both the 1918 Spanish Flu and the COVID-19 pandemic.
In 2019, she was celebrated and entered into the Guinness World Record.
Tanaka had a sweet tooth and enjoyed chocolate and fizzy drinks.
As you can see here, she also enjoyed cake.
